summary: This document is an email chain from December 2019 between U.S. prosecutors in the Southern District of New York and a Department of Justice attaché at the U.S. Embassy in London. The prosecutors are seeking to coordinate legal outreach regarding the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, specifically requesting contact with the 'Master of the Household' (likely a reference to Buckingham Palace staff) and discussing timing around a NATO event involving the President, Secretary of State, and Secretary of Defense.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual under investigation by the team of prosecutors from the Southern District of New York.

connections.person2: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: LS is coordinating with SDNY prosecutors on the timing and method for legal outreach related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: NATO Event in London
events.description: A NATO event occurring in London during the week of December 4, 2019, which involved the presence of the U.S. President, Secretary of State, and Secretary of Defense.

events.title: Approval for Legal Outreach Request
events.description: The SDNY prosecution team received approval to formally request outreach to the 'Master of the Household' regarding the Epstein investigation.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

locations: United States Embassy, 33 Nine Elms Lane, London
keyFacts: U.S. prosecutors from the SDNY were actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein as of December 2019.

The prosecutors sought to coordinate legal outreach to the 'Master of the Household', a title associated with Buckingham Palace, indicating potential UK royal household connections to the investigation.
Timing of the outreach was sensitive due to a NATO event in London involving the U.S. President, Secretary of State, and Secretary of Defense.
The correspondence discusses procedures for contacting individuals who may or may not already have legal representation.
The email chain demonstrates coordination between U.S. federal prosecutors and a DOJ attaché at the U.S. Embassy in London on investigative steps.
